activities.name: Select Tables That Require Masking
activities.description: Select tables with a data mapping and assigned algorithms, as well as filters that may be needed for conditional masking.

sqlReaderQuery.value:
WITH
tables_requiring_filters AS
(
	SELECT DISTINCT
		dataset, specified_database, specified_schema, identified_table
	FROM @{variables('METADATA_SCHEMA')}.@{variables('METADATA_RULESET_TABLE')}
	WHERE ISJSON(assigned_algorithm) = 1
	AND dataset = '@{variables('DATASET')}'
	AND specified_database = '@{pipeline().parameters.P_ORG_NAME}'
	AND specified_schema = '@{pipeline().parameters.P_ORG_NAME}'
),
tables_not_requiring_filters AS
(
	SELECT DISTINCT
		dataset, specified_database, specified_schema, identified_table
	FROM @{variables('METADATA_SCHEMA')}.@{variables('METADATA_RULESET_TABLE')}
	WHERE assigned_algorithm IS NOT NULL
	AND assigned_algorithm != ''
	AND dataset = '@{variables('DATASET')}'
	AND specified_database = '@{pipeline().parameters.P_ORG_NAME}'
	AND specified_schema = '@{pipeline().parameters.P_ORG_NAME}'
	EXCEPT
	SELECT dataset, specified_database, specified_schema, identified_table
	FROM tables_requiring_filters
	WHERE dataset = '@{variables('DATASET')}'
	AND specified_database = '@{pipeline().parameters.P_ORG_NAME}'
	AND specified_schema = '@{pipeline().parameters.P_ORG_NAME}'
),
all_filters AS
(
	SELECT DISTINCT
		JSON_VALUE(kc.value, '$.alias') as filter_alias,
		replace(JSON_VALUE(kc.value, '$.condition'), '@{variables('CONDITIONAL_MASKING_RESERVED_CHARACTER')}', concat('byName(''', d.identified_column, ''') ')) as filter_value,
		d.identified_table
	FROM @{variables('METADATA_SCHEMA')}.@{variables('METADATA_RULESET_TABLE')} d 
		CROSS APPLY OPENJSON(d.assigned_algorithm) kc
	WHERE
		ISJSON(assigned_algorithm,ARRAY) = 1
		AND
		d.identified_table in (
			SELECT identified_table FROM tables_requiring_filters
		)
		AND JSON_VALUE(kc.value,'$.alias') != 'default'
),
default_filters AS
(
	SELECT DISTINCT
		'default' as filter_alias,
		STRING_AGG(concat('not(', replace(JSON_VALUE(kc.value, '$.condition'), '@{variables('CONDITIONAL_MASKING_RESERVED_CHARACTER')}', concat('byName(''', d.identified_column, ''')')),')'), ' && ') as filter_value,
		d.identified_table
	FROM @{variables('METADATA_SCHEMA')}.@{variables('METADATA_RULESET_TABLE')} d 
		CROSS APPLY OPENJSON(d.assigned_algorithm) kc
	WHERE
		ISJSON(assigned_algorithm,ARRAY) = 1
		AND
		d.identified_table in (
			SELECT identified_table FROM tables_requiring_filters
		)
		AND JSON_VALUE(kc.value,'$.alias') != 'default'
	GROUP BY d.identified_table
),
sources_and_filters AS (
	SELECT
		t.dataset,
		t.specified_database,
		t.specified_schema,
		t.identified_table,
		f.filter_alias,
		f.filter_value
	FROM tables_requiring_filters t JOIN default_filters f
	ON t.identified_table = f.identified_table
	UNION
	SELECT
		t.dataset,
		t.specified_database,
		t.specified_schema,
		t.identified_table,
		f.filter_alias,
		f.filter_value
	FROM tables_requiring_filters t JOIN all_filters f
	ON t.identified_table = f.identified_table
	UNION
	SELECT
		dataset,
		specified_database,
		specified_schema,
		identified_table,
		'',
		''
	FROM tables_not_requiring_filters
)
SELECT DISTINCT
	dm.source_dataset,
	dm.source_database,
	dm.source_schema,
	dm.source_table,
	dm.sink_dataset,
	dm.sink_database,
	dm.sink_schema,
	dm.sink_table,
	rs.filter_alias,
	rs.filter_value
FROM
	sources_and_filters rs
	JOIN @{variables('METADATA_SCHEMA')}.@{variables('METADATA_SOURCE_TO_SINK_MAPPING_TABLE')} dm
	ON (
		rs.dataset = dm.source_dataset AND
		rs.specified_database = dm.source_database AND
		rs.specified_schema = dm.source_schema AND
		rs.identified_table = dm.source_table
	)
WHERE
	dm.sink_database = '@{pipeline().parameters.P_ORG_NAME}' AND
	dm.sink_schema = '@{pipeline().parameters.P_ORG_NAME}'
	AND (dm.mapping_complete IS NULL OR dm.mapping_complete = 0)
	AND (ISJSON(dm.masked_status) = 0  OR dm.masked_status IS NULL)
UNION
SELECT DISTINCT
	dm.source_dataset,
	dm.source_database,
	dm.source_schema,
	dm.source_table,
	dm.sink_dataset,
	dm.sink_database,
	dm.sink_schema,
	dm.sink_table,
	rs.filter_alias,
	rs.filter_value
FROM
	sources_and_filters rs
	JOIN @{variables('METADATA_SCHEMA')}.@{variables('METADATA_SOURCE_TO_SINK_MAPPING_TABLE')} dm
	CROSS APPLY OPENJSON(dm.masked_status) kc
	ON (
		rs.dataset = dm.source_dataset AND
		rs.specified_database = dm.source_database AND
		rs.specified_schema = dm.source_schema AND
		rs.identified_table = dm.source_table
	)
WHERE
	dm.sink_database = '@{pipeline().parameters.P_ORG_NAME}' AND
	dm.sink_schema = '@{pipeline().parameters.P_ORG_NAME}'
	AND (dm.mapping_complete IS NULL OR dm.mapping_complete = 0)
	AND ISJSON(dm.masked_status) = 1
	AND kc.[key] = rs.filter_alias
	AND kc.[value] = 'false'
	AND (
		(filter_alias = 'default' AND  
			identified_table IN (
				SELECT DISTINCT
					identified_table
			FROM @{variables('METADATA_SCHEMA')}.@{variables('METADATA_RULESET_TABLE')} d
				CROSS APPLY OPENJSON(d.assigned_algorithm) kc
			WHERE
				ISJSON(assigned_algorithm,ARRAY) = 1
				AND JSON_VALUE(kc.value, '$.alias') = 'default'
			)
		)
		OR
		(filter_alias != 'default')
	)

activities.name: Check For Conditional Masking
activities.description: Identify whether the table needs to be masked with conditional masking

ifFalseActivities.name: Perform Masking Per Table No Filter

message.value: Failed to mask @{item().source_table} with filter alias @{item().filter_alias}

activities.name: Configure Masked Status
activities.description: Configure Masked Status for a given table in the Source-to-Sink mapping table if it is not set. Masked Status will not be set if the table has not been masked before or if P_REAPPLY_MASKING parameter is set to true.

text.value:
WITH
    tables_requiring_filters AS (
        SELECT DISTINCT
            dataset, specified_database, specified_schema, identified_table
        FROM @{variables('METADATA_SCHEMA')}.@{variables('METADATA_RULESET_TABLE')}
        WHERE ISJSON(assigned_algorithm) = 1
            AND dataset = '@{variables('DATASET')}'
            AND specified_database = '@{pipeline().parameters.P_ORG_NAME}'
            AND specified_schema = '@{pipeline().parameters.P_ORG_NAME}'
    ), all_filters AS (
        SELECT DISTINCT
            JSON_VALUE(kc.value, '$.alias') as filter_alias,
            identified_table
        FROM @{variables('METADATA_SCHEMA')}.@{variables('METADATA_RULESET_TABLE')} d
            CROSS APPLY OPENJSON(d.assigned_algorithm) kc
        WHERE
            ISJSON(d.assigned_algorithm,ARRAY) = 1
            AND
            d.identified_table in (
                SELECT identified_table FROM tables_requiring_filters
            )
    ), sources_and_filters AS (
        SELECT
            dataset,
            specified_database,
            specified_schema,
            tables_requiring_filters.identified_table,
            JSON_OBJECTAGG(filter_alias:CAST(0 as BIT)) AS masked_status
        FROM tables_requiring_filters
            INNER JOIN all_filters
            ON tables_requiring_filters.identified_table = all_filters.identified_table
        GROUP BY dataset, specified_database, specified_schema, tables_requiring_filters.identified_table
    )
    UPDATE @{variables('METADATA_SCHEMA')}.@{variables('METADATA_SOURCE_TO_SINK_MAPPING_TABLE')}
    SET masked_status = sf.masked_status
    FROM sources_and_filters sf
    INNER JOIN @{variables('METADATA_SCHEMA')}.@{variables('METADATA_SOURCE_TO_SINK_MAPPING_TABLE')} dm ON
        dm.source_dataset = sf.dataset AND
        dm.source_database = sf.specified_database AND
        dm.source_schema = sf.specified_schema AND
        dm.source_table = sf.identified_table
    WHERE
        dm.masked_status IS NULL
        AND (dm.mapping_complete IS NULL OR dm.mapping_complete = 0)

activities.name: Mark Tables Undiscovered
activities.description: Mark all tables in this database and schema as undiscovered so that we can re-discover sensitive data in them

text.value:
UPDATE
    @{variables('METADATA_SCHEMA')}.@{variables('METADATA_SOURCE_TO_SINK_MAPPING_TABLE')}
SET
    mapping_complete = CAST(0 AS BIT),
    masked_status = NULL
WHERE
    UPPER(source_dataset) = UPPER('@{variables('DATASET')}')
    AND UPPER(source_database) = UPPER('@{pipeline().parameters.P_ORG_NAME}')
    AND UPPER(source_schema) = UPPER('@{pipeline().parameters.P_ORG_NAME}')
    AND LOWER('@{pipeline().parameters.P_FIRST_RUN_AFTER_REFRESH}') = 'true'

sources.name: Source
sources.description: Select source data at DF_SOURCE_SCHEMA.DF_SOURCE_TABLE using an inline dataset

transformations.name: AddSortKey
transformations.description: Create column DELPHIX_COMPLIANCE_SERVICE_SORT_ID that consists of SHA of the data across all columns in the table - every row will have this value and it cannot be null

transformations.name: SortBySortKey
transformations.description: Sort the table by the value in DELPHIX_COMPLIANCE_SERVICE_SORT_ID, as we need the table to be in a particular order before we apply a surrogate key

transformations.name: CreateSurrogateKey
transformations.description: Add a DELPHIX_COMPLIANCE_SERVICE_BATCH_ID column that increments by 1 and starts at 1 after applying the sorting

transformations.name: WrapValuesInArray
transformations.description: For each column we wish to mask, convert the value into an array, this is needed to preserve null values as null when using collect, as null values become [], and encode the column names to handle body type mapping changes

transformations.name: AggregateColumnsByBatch
transformations.description: For each column we wish to mask, aggregate to a list using collect, grouped by DELPHIX_COMPLIANCE_SERVICE_BATCH_ID with integer division by DF_NUMBER_OF_ROWS_PER_BATCH - so there will be a targeted number of total rows in each aggregation, name the group as DELPHIX_COMPLIANCE_SERVICE_BATCH_GROUP

transformations.name: FlattenValuesOutOfArray
transformations.description: For each column we wish to mask, flatten the value out of the array, in the case where the value was previously [], it becomes null

transformations.name: AssertNoFailures
transformations.description: Confirm that we received a 200 response status from the API request

transformations.name: FlattenAggregateData
transformations.description: Unroll the API response body into decoded named columns

transformations.name: TrimMaskedStrings
transformations.description: For each column with a string type, trim the string to length based on the value in DF_TRIM_LENGTHS - this is needed as masking a string may produce a longer string that exceeds the column width in the sink

transformations.name: CastColumnsBackAsRequired
transformations.description: For columns that need to be cast back to a compatible type, cast them back

transformations.name: RemoveColumns
transformations.description: Remove columns that are not required for mapping

scriptLines: DF_BODY_TYPE_MAPPING as string ('(timestamp as date, status as string, message as string, trace_id as string, items as (DELPHIX_COMPLIANCE_SERVICE_BATCH_ID as long)[])'),

query: (concat('<fetch version="1.0" output-format="xml-platform" mapping="logical" distinct="false"><entity name="', $DF_SOURCE_TABLE, '"><attribute name="', $DF_PRIMARY_KEY, '" />', reduce($DF_COLUMNS_TO_MASK, '', #acc + '<attribute name="' + #item + '" />', #result), '<filter type="and"><condition attribute="createdon" operator="on-or-after" value="', $DF_CREATED_AFTER, '" /><condition attribute="createdon" operator="on-or-before" value="', $DF_CREATED_BEFORE, '" /><filter type="or">', reduce($DF_COLUMNS_TO_MASK, '', #acc + '<condition attribute="' + #item + '" operator="not-null" />', #result), '</filter></filter></entity></fetch>')),
body as (timestamp as date, status as string, message as string, trace_id as string, items as (DELPHIX_COMPLIANCE_SERVICE_BATCH_ID as long)[]),

DCSForAzureAPI assert(expectTrue(toInteger(regexExtract(status, '(\\d+)', 1)) == 200, false, 'Failed_request', null, iif(isNull(body.message), status, concatWS(', ', 'timestamp: ' + toString(body.timestamp), 'status: ' + body.status, 'message: ' + body.message, 'trace_id: ' + body.trace_id))),

CastColumnsBackAsRequired derive(each(match(type=='string'), $$ = iif(greater($DF_TRIM_LENGTHS[toInteger($# - 1)], 0), substring($$, 1, $DF_TRIM_LENGTHS[toInteger($# - 1)]), toString($$)))) ~> TrimMaskedStrings

sources.name: Source
sources.description: Select source data at DF_SOURCE_SCHEMA.DF_SOURCE_TABLE using an inline dataset

sinks.name: Sink
sinks.description: Sink results of masking to data store by sinking the unrolled results of the masking call to the columns of the same name in the data sink

transformations.name: AddSortKey
transformations.description: Create column DELPHIX_COMPLIANCE_SERVICE_SORT_ID that consists of SHA of the data across all columns in the table - every row will have this value and it cannot be null

transformations.name: SortBySortKey
transformations.description: Sort the table by the value in DELPHIX_COMPLIANCE_SERVICE_SORT_ID, as we need the table to be in a particular order before we apply a surrogate key

transformations.name: CreateSurrogateKey
transformations.description: Add a DELPHIX_COMPLIANCE_SERVICE_BATCH_ID column that increments by 1 and starts at 1 after applying the sorting

transformations.name: SelectPrimaryKey
transformations.description: Select only columns that don't require masking

transformations.name: AggregateColumnsByBatch
transformations.description: For each column we wish to mask, aggregate to a list using collect, grouped by DELPHIX_COMPLIANCE_SERVICE_BATCH_ID with integer division by DF_NUMBER_OF_ROWS_PER_BATCH - so there will be a targeted number of total rows in each aggregation, name the group as DELPHIX_COMPLIANCE_SERVICE_BATCH_GROUP

transformations.name: FlattenValuesOutOfArray
transformations.description: For each column we wish to mask, flatten the value out of the array, in the case where the value was previously [], it becomes null

transformations.name: AssertNoFailures
transformations.description: Confirm that we received a 200 response status from the API request

transformations.name: FlattenAggregateData
transformations.description: Unroll the API response body into decoded named columns

transformations.name: JoinMaskedColumnsandPrimaryKey
transformations.description: Inner join on SelectColumnsUnmasked and TrimMaskedStrings based on matching DELPHIX_COMPLIANCE_SERVICE_BATCH_ID

transformations.name: TrimMaskedStrings
transformations.description: For each column with a string type, trim the string to length based on the value in DF_TRIM_LENGTHS - this is needed as masking a string may produce a longer string that exceeds the column width in the sink

transformations.name: ApplyTableFilter
transformations.description: Filter base table based on supplied filter

transformations.name: CastRequiredColumnsAsStrings
transformations.description: For columns that require casting to string, cast them to string

transformations.name: CastColumnsBackAsRequired
transformations.description: For columns that need to be cast back to a compatible type, cast them back

transformations.name: WrapValuesInArray
transformations.description: For each column we wish to mask, convert the value into an array, this is needed to preserve null values as null when using collect, as null values become [], and encode the column names to handle body type mapping changes

transformations.name: RemoveColumns
transformations.description: Remove columns that are not required for mapping

scriptLines: DF_BODY_TYPE_MAPPING as string ('(timestamp as date, status as string, message as string, trace_id as string, items as (DELPHIX_COMPLIANCE_SERVICE_BATCH_ID as long)[])'),

query: (concat('<fetch version="1.0" output-format="xml-platform" mapping="logical" distinct="false"><entity name="', $DF_SOURCE_TABLE, '"><all-attributes /><filter type="and"><condition attribute="createdon" operator="on-or-after" value="', $DF_CREATED_AFTER, '" /><condition attribute="createdon" operator="on-or-before" value="', $DF_CREATED_BEFORE, '" /></filter></entity></fetch>')),
body as (timestamp as date, status as string, message as string, trace_id as string, items as (DELPHIX_COMPLIANCE_SERVICE_BATCH_ID as long)[]),

DCSForAzureAPI assert(expectTrue(toInteger(regexExtract(status, '(\\d+)', 1)) == 200, false, 'Failed_request', null, iif(isNull(body.message), status, concatWS(', ', 'timestamp: ' + toString(body.timestamp), 'status: ' + body.status, 'message: ' + body.message, 'trace_id: ' + body.trace_id))),

CastColumnsBackAsRequired derive(each(match(type=='string'), $$ = iif(greater($DF_TRIM_LENGTHS[toInteger($# - 1)], 0), substring($$, 1, $DF_TRIM_LENGTHS[toInteger($# - 1)]), toString($$)))) ~> TrimMaskedStrings
